dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I'm stoked to chat with you, so what's up, wanna talk about Golden Retrievers?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Sure!  I love dogs.  And who doesn't love Golden retrievers?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: They're literally the best, right? I mean, they're bred to retrieve game, but they're also amazing family dogs!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: They seem like the most gentle and friendly breed of dog.  I've never met one that didn't love being around people.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Totally! Their friendly tempers make 'em perfect for families and even as assistance dogs, like guide dogs for the blind!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Oh cool.  So they're pretty smart too, relative to other dogs?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Yeah, they're super intelligent and easy to train, which is why they're often used as service dogs, search and rescue, and even hunting dogs!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: That's cool.  I didn't know they were search and rescue dogs.  What other things can they be trained to do?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: They're also trained as detection dogs, like sniffing out stuff, and they even participate in conformation shows, showing off their good looks!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I assume they are one of the most popular dogs worldwide?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: They're super popular, like, in the top 10 most popular breeds in the US, UK, Australia, and Brazil, and they're often the third most popular family dog breed in the States!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Where were the first golden retrievers bred?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: The conversation history doesn't mention the origin of the Golden Retriever breed.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Do they shed?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Yeah, they shed a ton, especially during seasonal changes, so they need regular grooming!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I thought so.  Those coats seem pretty thick.  I bet they are nice and warm even in colder temperatures.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Their thick coats keep 'em warm and cozy, and the outer layer is even water-repellent, which is perfect for their love of water!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I didn't know that.  Is it common for dog fur to be water repellent?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Nah, it's not super common, but Golden Retrievers have that special double coat that helps 'em shake off water and stay dry!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: A double coat you say?  So they have a water repellent one on the outside and I assume a softer, warmer one on the inside?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: They've got a dense, soft undercoat that keeps 'em warm, and that water-repellent outer coat that lies flat against their body, pretty cool combo!
